intro: Stenogyne ciliata, commonly known as the hairy false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland areas. Stenogyne ciliata plays an important ecological role in supporting native pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its habitat.
